explanation:
To determine whether MHD_create_response_from_data participates in direct or indirect recursion you must examine every function it calls and any functions those call, to see if any call path returns to MHD_create_response_from_data. Specifically:

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer: This is called directly by the target function; its body (or its call graph) must be inspected to see if it calls MHD_create_response_from_data or any function that eventually does.
- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls: Listed as a callee of MHD_create_response_from_buffer; its implementation/call graph must be checked for any path that leads back to MHD_create_response_from_data.
- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy: Also called by MHD_create_response_from_buffer; its implementation/call graph must be checked for any path that leads back to MHD_create_response_from_data.

Note: If any of the above functions call additional functions, those callees must also be included recursively until no new reachable functions appear; only then can you conclude whether an indirect recursion cycle back to MHD_create_response_from_data exists.
